Description: Large fragment of Cypriot pottery mortarium (2 joining fragments), wavy outside wall, flat base. Beige-yellow clay, core light orange, quite dense and hard. Graffito dedication to Apollo on outside wall below lip: ]τωπολλω[.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (p. 61, pl. XXXII, no. 78)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 646, no. 39, pl. 19.2)
Schlotzhauer & Villing 2006 / East Greek Pottery from Naukratis: The Current State of Research (p. 55, Table 1, Nauk 35)
Villing 2006 / 'Drab Bowls' for Apollo: The Mortaria of Naukratis and Exchange in the Archaic Eastern Mediterranean (p. 31 fig. 2, no. 2)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (HA.04)

Spataro and Villing 2009 / Scientific investigation of pottery grinding bowls from the Archaic and Classical Eastern Mediterranean (p.91, fig.3, p.93, table.1, p.95, p.96, p.97, fig.8, p.98, fig.9) (N1)
